title: Scientific Research
text:
Subsistence Impacts on Occipital Biomechanics
    Occipital bone morphology across hunter-gatherer, horticultural, and agricultural skeletal collections reveals systematic variation in biomechanical loading by subsistence type and sex.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Smelling in the Wild
    Field and lab study of odor identification in real-world environments, combining a published study with new analysis.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Peripheral Resilience -- Ryukyu Colonialism
    GLM analysis of skeletal health markers from three colonial-era Ryukyu burial sites tests whether distance from Japanese colonial centers shaped health outcomes by geography and sex.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Market Integration -- Hadza
    This repository contains data, scripts, markdowns, and preprints for Market integration improves traditional Hadza male childhood health with no effect on females.
    
      DOI
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Odorant Receptor Variation in Homo
    Code and data for Functional expression of odorant receptors in extinct hominins and ancient humans.
    
      DOI
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Surveillance, Trust & Policing at Music Festivals
    Scripts and data for a project on surveillance and policing at summer music festivals.
    
      DOI
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Developmental Instability -- Nigerian Baboons
    Data and scripts for Developmental Stress in Wild Nigerian Olive Baboons.
    
      DOI
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Hunter-Gatherer Resilience & Agricultural Expansion
    Scripts and data for the analysis of resilience in skeletal remains across prehistoric Jomon archaeological sites in Kyushu Japan during the Yayoi agricultural transition.
    
      DOI
      GitHub repo

title: Applied & Policy Research
text:
Global R&D Leadership Forecasting and Policy Modelling
    Time series and regression analysis of aging demographics and R&D productivity across six world regions using V-Dem and World Bank data, 1996--2019.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Two-Century Trend -- Wealth & Democracy
    Two-century cross-national analysis of education, wealth, and participatory democracy.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Women in Governance & Women's Empowerment
    Cross-national analysis of women's representation in governance, educational gender parity, and egalitarian democracy across six regions using V-Dem and World Bank data.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Benchmarking Global Research Impact
    Bibliometric framework for benchmarking research impact across countries and fields of research.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Terrorism Endangers Ape Conservation
    QGIS mapping of terrorism attacks within primate habitats in sub-Saharan Africa shows a concentration in Africa's poorest, least democratic regions.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Terrorism in China -- Uyghur Areas
    QGIS mapping of GTD terrorism data (China, 2010--2018) reveals geographic concentration of attacks in Uyghur-majority regions.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Access to Health Care Workers & Life Expectancy
    Health care worker density positively impacts life expectancy outcomes by up to a year. Oral health is often neglected due to lack of access to a provider and costs even though poor oral health increases mortality risk.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Water-Related Extreme Weather Events (USA 1996--2011)
    Spatial and temporal analysis of severe weather events identifies storm and flood types with the greatest fatality, injury, and property damage impacts across the US.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Fitness Tracking: Classifying Bicep Curl Form
    Random forest and gradient boosting models applied to wearable accelerometer data classify bicep curls into correct and incorrect forms.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Human Variation Challenges Face Recognition Technology
    Evaluate whether a state-of-the-art face recognition model (FaceNet) shows performance disparities across race, gender, and age.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Morph Attack Detection Using ResNet
    Train a binary classifier to distinguish genuine face images from morphed (blended) images and understand presentation attack detection workflows.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    XAI Prompt Engineering Using Bedrock
    Few-shot prompt engineering for biometric sensor classification -- parameter optimization across Temperature, Top-K, and Top-P via AWS Bedrock.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Document Validation Using AWS Bedrock
    Serverless document validation and auditing pipeline using Claude 3 Haiku via AWS Bedrock.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo
    
  

  
    Shiny Applications
    Four interactive Shiny applications: NSF award exploration, democracy indicators, next word prediction, and speed/distance calculation.
    
      Portfolio page
      GitHub repo

title: About Me
text:
I’m a biological anthropologist and data scientist with expertise spanning human biological variation, environmental health, and applied data analytics. My career bridges academic research, federal agencies, and industry, where I’ve led technical projects that integrate biological data, policy analysis, and computational methods to address complex questions in public health, international science policy, and social equity.
My academic research has examined human adaptation and variation across multiple biological systems – from developmental stress and climate adaptation to biomechanics of the skull and postcranial skeleton, genetic epidemiology of West Nile Virus, and the evolution and ecology of human olfaction. I’m particularly interested in how environmental change shapes human biology and creates health inequities, including Anthropocene-induced sensory inequities.
Throughout my career, I’ve applied data analytics to diverse questions, from population genetics and biomechanics to policy research and international science strategy. Over the past five years, my analytical focus has shifted toward natural language processing, network analysis, bibliometrics, and predictive modeling for policy applications. My recent work has centered on international science and technology policy, analyzing global R&D trends, research collaboration networks, and the relationship between democracy, education, and governance. I’ve developed interactive applications and analytical pipelines to evaluate program impact, forecast shifts in global research leadership, and examine connections between women’s empowerment and demographic outcomes.
My technical toolkit includes R, Python, and SQL for statistical analysis and modeling, with expertise in Bayesian methods, machine learning, geospatial analysis (QGIS, ArcGIS), phylogenetic analysis, text mining and NLP, network analysis, and interactive data visualization using Shiny and Quarto. I use GitHub for version control and collaborative development. I’m experienced in managing large datasets, building ETL pipelines, and developing reproducible analytical workflows that translate complex data into actionable intelligence and compelling visual narratives.

title: About Me
section: I thrive in collaborative, interdisciplinary environments and have experience mentoring students, coordinating multi-institutional research teams, and communicating complex findings to diverse audiences – from academic peers to policy stakeholders. Whether leading technical analyses, designing research strategies, or serving as a bridge between research and application, I’m driven by work that combines rigorous science with real-world impact.
text:
I thrive in collaborative, interdisciplinary environments and have experience mentoring students, coordinating multi-institutional research teams, and communicating complex findings to diverse audiences – from academic peers to policy stakeholders. Whether leading technical analyses, designing research strategies, or serving as a bridge between research and application, I’m driven by work that combines rigorous science with real-world impact.
ORCID | Google Scholar | GitHub

title: Kara C. Hoover
text:
Kara C. Hoover
  Biological Anthropologist & Data Scientist

  
    My experience bridges academic research to policy analysis and applied analytics. My domain expertise in anthropology is human biological and genetic variation and adaptation. My scientific research focuses on developmental instability & health disparity, olfactory science ecology & genetics, and climate health & adaptation. My applied projects focus primarily on social policy, international science, research landscape scoping, and forecasting. I specialize in translating complex data and research questions into actionable results through reproducible end-to-end workflows. 
  

  
   ORCID
    Google Scholar
    GitHub
